Quotes: The flower that smells the sweetest is shy and lowly…
Author: William Wordsworth

Quotes: Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world…
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quotes: Relationships are based on four principles: respect, understanding, acceptance and appreciation…
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: Every experience, no matter how bad it seems, holds within it a blessing of some kind. The goal is to find it…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant…
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quotes: Everything you say should be true, but not everything true should be said…
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: One who believes in himself has no need to convince others…
Author: Laozi

Quotes: No man truly has joy unless he lives in love…
Author: St. Thomas Aquinas

Quotes: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail…
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Do not judge yourself harshly. Without mercy for ourselves we cannot love the world…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: The only thing more dangerous than ignorance is arrogance…
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: It is better to act and repent than not to act and regret…
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: Hope is nature's veil for hiding truth's nakedness…
Author: Alfred Nobel

Quotes: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered;the point is to discover them…
Author: Galileo Galilei

Quotes: What we know is a drop, what we don't know is an ocean…
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: Patience is the strength of the weak, impatience is the weakness of the strong…
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quotes: A cold and moist brain is an inseparable companion to folly…
Author: Galen

Quotes: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts…
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quotes: A great man is hard on himself;a small man is hard on others…
Author: Confucius

Quotes: The less you have, the less you have to worry about…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: Have more than you show, speak less than you know…
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: You should never be ashamed to admit you have been wrong. It only proves you are wiser today than yesterday…
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quotes: A very little key will open a very heavy door…
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: What happens is not as important as how you react to what happens…
Author: Ellen Glasgow

Quotes: Dogs are better than human beings because they know but do not tell…
Author: Emily Dickinson

Quotes: He who has health, has hope;and he who has hope, has everything…
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quotes: Make money your god, and it will plague you like the devil…
Author: Henry Fielding

Quotes: Doubt everything. Find your own light…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: Take a chance and you may lose. Take not a chance and you have lost already…
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quotes: Don't educate your children to be rich. Educate them to be happy, so they know the value of things, not the price…
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: A man who fears suffering is already suffering from what he fears…
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quotes: We do not describe the world we see, we see the world we can describe…
Author: Rene Descartes

Quotes: You can be pleased with nothing if you are not pleased with yourself…
Author: Mary Wortley Montagu

Quotes: Keep your face always toward the sunshine – and shadows will fall behind you…
Author: Walt Whitman

Quotes: Every step we take on earth brings us to a new world…
Author: Federico García Lorca

Quotes: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today…
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing…
Author: Socrates

Quotes: A hero is the one who does what he can…
Author: Romain Rolland

Quotes: A Persons tongue can give you the taste of his heart…
Author: Ibn Qayyim Al Jawziyyah

Quotes: We do not really think, we are barely conscious, until something goes wrong…
Author: Charles Sanders Peirce

Quotes: If you can't live alone, you were born a slave…
Author: Fernando Pessoa

Quotes: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day;teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime…
Author: Maimonides

Quotes: We can complain because rose bushes have thorns or rejoice because thorn bushes have roses…
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: See all living beings as your father or mother, and love them as if you were their child…
Author: Atisa

Quotes: Take what you need, do what you should, you will get what you want…
Author: Gottfried Leibniz

Quotes: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him…
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: After the verb “to love”, “to help” is the most beautiful verb in the world…
Author: Bertha von Suttner

Quotes: A bottle of wine contains more philosophy than all the books in the world…
Author: Louis Pasteur

Quotes: If the first button of one's coat is wrongly buttoned, all the rest will be crooked…
Author: Giordano Bruno

Quotes: Conquer yourself rather than the world…
Author: Rene Descartes

Quotes: Change is never painful. Only the resistance to change is painful…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters…
Author: Epictetus

Quotes: The good we do today becomes the happiness of tomorrow…
Author: William James

Quotes: Those who understand others are clever, those who understand themselves are wise…
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: Follow your path, and let the people talk…
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: Never trust your tongue when your heart is bitter…
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quotes: Anything one man can imagine, other men can make real…
Author: Jules Verne

Quotes: Silence is the best response to a fool…
Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

Quotes: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be…
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quotes: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds…
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power…
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Falling down is not a failure. Failure comes when you stay where you have fallen…
Author: Socrates

Quotes: The production of too many useful things results in too many useless people…
Author: Karl Marx

Quotes: Beauty without intelligence is like a hook without bait…
Author: Moliere

Quotes: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains…
Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life…
Author: Charles Darwin

Quotes: I think a bad husband is far worse than no husband…
Author: Margaret Cavendish

Quotes: Success is not something to wait for, it is something to work for…
Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

Quotes: The achievement of one goal should be the starting point of another…
Author: Alexander Graham Bell

Quotes: Believe only half of what you see and nothing that you hear…
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quotes: It is difficult to find happiness within oneself, but it is impossible to find it anywhere else…
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quotes: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall…
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Happiness will never come to those who fail to appreciate what they already have…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: Wise men speak because they have something to say;Fools because they have to say something…
Author: Plato

Quotes: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see…
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Life is like a cup of tea, the sugar is all at the bottom!…
Author: Julia Ward Howe

Quotes: Our greatest ability as humans is not to change the world;but to change ourselves…
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quotes: Go wisely and slowly. Those who rush stumble and fall…
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Think for yourself, or others will think for you without thinking of you…
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quotes: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas…
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: Do not learn how to react. Learn how to respond…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha

Quotes: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all…
Author: Aristotle

Quotes: Belief begins where science leaves off and ends where science begins…
Author: Rudolf Virchow

Quotes: Bad company ruins good morals…
Author: Paul the Apostle

Quotes: In the small matters trust the mind, in the large ones the heart…
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quotes: My language is the sum total of myself…
Author: Charles Sanders Peirce

Quotes: My powers are ordinary. Only my application brings me success…
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: The childhood shows the man, as morning shows the day…
Author: John Milton

Quotes: In every picture there should be shade as well as light…
Author: James Boswell

Quotes: Where the road bends abruptly, take short steps…
Author: Ernest Bramah

Quotes: Either define the moment or the moment will define you…
Author: Walt Whitman

Quotes: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love…
Author: William Wordsworth

Quotes: The best men are not consistent in good – why should the worst men be consistent in evil…
Author: Wilkie Collins

Quotes: If your past is limited, your future is boundless…
Author: Franklin Pierce

Quotes: There are two different types of people in the world, those who want to know, and those who want to believe…
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see…
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quotes: If you want to make life easy, make it hard…
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The first and the best victory is to conquer self…
Author: Plato

Quotes: It is not the germs we need worry about. It is our inner terrain…
Author: Louis Pasteur

Quotes: All life is temporary. Why worry about anything that's only temporary?…
Author: Gautama The Lord Buddha
